bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, November 4, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D DEC 4 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: No. 39, Consular Series. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Nov. 4, 1899.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge, herewith, the receipt, Nov. 3, of the shipment of 5 bent wood cain bottom office chairs; 62 yards of carpiting; and one water filter; for use in this Legation; forwarded by J. P. Roosa Esq., United States Despatch Agent, New York; Sept. 27, 1899. Be so kind as to accept my thanks for same. I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, M. R. and C. General.
